relation: Great for these types of students
I'm pretty sure they have a club for every major which is rare in technical colleges. I'm a CRJ major and they even have a club for us!
Location location location. Plus Charleston is just an all around great city to live in!
It's Charleston!! Go downtown, head to Folly Beach, explore historic parts of town, go to Tanger outlets, or just relax at the battery. Never Bored.
They do have a cafe, never been in it though.
There are no dorms since it's a technical college.
I haven't attended any classes yet.

Get your transcripts sent early, call the office if you have any questions, you'd be amazed at how helpful they can be based on your situation. Keep track of all deadlines for financial aid, applications, and registration.
Easy to apply Helpful admissions staff Great location
pageTitle: Trident Technical College Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {285525=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 179888=With Lottery Assisted Tuition (SC residence only) the cost of attendance is pretty low. Only about $2000 a semester., 2426=I have been at Trident since August of 2010 and so far I have nothing bad to say about the teacher and academic advisers who I have had or come into contact with. I have a full 15-hr schedule this semester and although my classes are all quite different and unique, I am learning many new things in them. One of my favorite classes is Western Civ post-1689; which may not sound important but it is because I usually resent history classes about western civilizations. This one however, I quite enjoy.}
textBeforeTable: 10/06/2010 Reviewer is A current student here. 10 out of 10 people found this review useful. 1 of 71 Katherine from Charleston, SC Check out reviews left by other students or leave your own review. textAfterTable: Tips for prospective students Do NOT get your books until after the start of classes. Some of the teachers do not even use the books that the bookstore tells you that you must have for the class. For my history class last semester, I never used the book at all. My English teacher for this semester told the class straight up that we would not need the books for her class either. If you are getting financial aid, make sure you apply early. The financial aid office has a history of pulling people around in circles and canceling grants at the last moment. Do not wait until the deadline to get things paid for. If you do not pay on time, then you lose your schedule and your classes and you have to re-register and hope that the classes are still available. Go to the first day of class! Most of the teachers at Trident will give notes on the first day of class, so make sure that you go. Bang for the buck You get what you pay for. Trident is a very in-expensive school. The classes are just enough to be able to transfer to a 4-year school. Scheduling can just be plain miserable since the system they have set up for that is not too effective. They do though have a really nice learning center that allows
